metadata.feature_description: Configure Active Directory authentication settings including Windows authentication, domain settings, and authentication credentials

steps.action: Navigate to Extensions > Authentication Systems and access AD Authentication settings
steps.expected: AD Authentication Settings page loads with Windows Authentication checkbox
steps.actual: Settings page loaded successfully showing Windows Authentication checkbox (unchecked by default)

steps.expected: Checkbox becomes checked and additional settings fields appear
steps.actual: Checkbox was checked successfully and all settings fields remained visible

steps.action: Uncheck the Windows Authentication checkbox and save
steps.actual: Settings saved successfully with Windows Authentication disabled

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Configure root domain and email domain

steps.expected: Text is accepted in the Root Domain field
steps.actual: Text 'test.local' was entered successfully in the Root Domain field

steps.expected: Text is accepted in the Email Domain field
steps.actual: Text 'test.local' was entered successfully in the Email Domain field

steps.action: Enter matching passwords in Password and Confirm Password fields
steps.expected: Passwords are accepted without validation error
steps.actual: Passwords were entered and accepted (shown as masked characters)

steps.action: Save settings and verify password fields persist
steps.expected: Password fields show masked values after save
steps.actual: After saving, password fields displayed masked characters indicating values were persisted

steps.action: Save settings with AD configuration and observe network status
steps.expected: Network status indicators show connection results
steps.actual: Network status displayed showing: Global Catalog Status: FAIL, Root Domain Status: FAIL, LDAP Status: FAIL, Network Domains Status: FAIL. This is expected as no real AD server is configured.

steps.action: Open Authentication Type dropdown and verify available options
steps.actual: Dropdown showed authentication types including Delegation, Secure, SecureSocketsLayer, etc.

steps.expected: Authentication type changes to selected value
steps.actual: Authentication Type was successfully changed to 'Secure'

steps.action: Configure multiple settings and click Update button
steps.actual: Settings were saved with network status displayed

steps.action: Navigate away and return to settings page
steps.actual: Settings were persisted - Root Domain showed 'test.local', Authentication Type showed 'Secure', checkbox states maintained

steps.action: Enter invalid IP address 'invalid.ip' in Auto-login IP Address field and save
steps.expected: Validation error indicates invalid IP format
steps.actual: The field showed a red underline validation indicator when invalid format was detected. Per code review, IP validation requires 4 octets (xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx format).

observations: The 'Synchronize Password?' checkbox row is set to Visible='False' in the ASCX markup, so this feature is hidden from the UI but exists in code.
The 'Strip Domain?' checkbox is also set to Visible='false' in both the label and checkbox controls.
Default search bots value is pre-populated as 'gsa-crawler;MS Search 5.0 Robot' when empty.
Network status indicators correctly show FAIL states when no Active Directory server is available - this is expected behavior.
IP validation in code (CheckEnteredIPAddr method) requires exactly 4 octets in the IP address format and validates using Utilities.GetIP4Address().
Password fields use CompareValidator to ensure Password and Confirm Password match before saving.
The extension had to be installed from Available Extensions before testing could proceed.
